narrative.title: 1St South African Division - 1940Q4
narrative.situation: British Infantry Division (Commonwealth - South African) deployed in North Africa during 1940Q4.
narrative.objectives: Standard British Commonwealth infantry division organized for offensive operations in East Africa against Italian forces. Mission: participate in invasion of Italian East Africa (Ethiopia/Somaliland) as part of larger British offensive.
narrative.axis_objective: Hold current positions and prevent Allied breakthrough.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and neutralize Axis defensive positions.

weather.terrain: Semi-arid scrubland and bush in northern Kenya (Kenya-Ethiopia border region)

air_support.note: No theater air summary available for this quarter

special_rules: First South African division deployed overseas in WWII
Combined-arms coordination (infantry, armor, artillery, air support demonstrated at El Wak)

environment.terrain_type: Semi-arid scrubland and bush in northern Kenya (Kenya-Ethiopia border region)
